user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of lfs_bd_crc:
```c
static int lfs_bd_crc(lfs_t *lfs,
        const lfs_cache_t *pcache, lfs_cache_t *rcache, lfs_size_t hint,
        lfs_block_t block, lfs_off_t off, lfs_size_t size, uint32_t *crc) {
    lfs_size_t diff = 0;

    for (lfs_off_t i = 0; i < size; i += diff) {
        uint8_t dat[8];
        diff = lfs_min(size-i, sizeof(dat));
        int err = lfs_bd_read(lfs,
                pcache, rcache, hint-i,
                block, off+i, &dat, diff);
        if (err) {
            return err;
        }

        *crc = lfs_crc(*crc, &dat, diff);
    }

    return 0;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function lfs_bd_crc:
static int lfs_bd_read(lfs_t *lfs,
        const lfs_cache_t *pcache, lfs_cache_t *rcache, lfs_size_t hint,
        lfs_block_t block, lfs_off_t off,
        void *buffer, lfs_size_t size) {
    uint8_t *data = buffer;
    if (off+size > lfs->cfg->block_size
            || (lfs->block_count && block >= lfs->block_count)) {
        return LFS_ERR_CORRUPT;
    }

    while (size > 0) {
        lfs_size_t diff = size;

        if (pcache && block == pcache->block &&
                off < pcache->off + pcache->size) {
            if (off >= pcache->off) {
                // is already in pcache?
                diff = lfs_min(diff, pcache->size - (off-pcache->off));
                memcpy(data, &pcache->buffer[off-pcache->off], diff);

                data += diff;
                off += diff;
                size -= diff;
                continue;
            }

            // pcache takes priority
            diff = lfs_min(diff, pcache->off-off);
        }

        if (block == rcache->block &&
                off < rcache->off + rcache->size) {
            if (off >= rcache->off) {
                // is already in rcache?
                diff = lfs_min(diff, rcache->size - (off-rcache->off));
                memcpy(data, &rcache->buffer[off-rcache->off], diff);

                data += diff;
                off += diff;
                size -= diff;
                continue;
            }

            // rcache takes priority
            diff = lfs_min(diff, rcache->off-off);
        }

        if (size >= hint && off % lfs->cfg->read_size == 0 &&
                size >= lfs->cfg->read_size) {
            // bypass cache?
            diff = lfs_aligndown(diff, lfs->cfg->read_size);
            int err = lfs->cfg->read(lfs->cfg, block, off, data, diff);
            if (err) {
                return err;
            }

            data += diff;
            off += diff;
            size -= diff;
            continue;
        }

        // load to cache, first condition can no longer fail
        LFS_ASSERT(!lfs->block_count || block < lfs->block_count);
        rcache->block = block;
        rcache->off = lfs_aligndown(off, lfs->cfg->read_size);
        rcache->size = lfs_min(
                lfs_min(
                    lfs_alignup(off+hint, lfs->cfg->read_size),
                    lfs->cfg->block_size)
                - rcache->off,
                lfs->cfg->cache_size);
        int err = lfs->cfg->read(lfs->cfg, rcache->block,
                rcache->off, rcache->buffer, rcache->size);
        LFS_ASSERT(err <= 0);
        if (err) {
            return err;
        }
    }

    return 0;
}
...
uint32_t lfs_crc(uint32_t crc, const void *buffer, size_t size) {
    static const uint32_t rtable[16] = {
        0x00000000, 0x1db71064, 0x3b6e20c8, 0x26d930ac,
        0x76dc4190, 0x6b6b51f4, 0x4db26158, 0x5005713c,
        0xedb88320, 0xf00f9344, 0xd6d6a3e8, 0xcb61b38c,
        0x9b64c2b0, 0x86d3d2d4, 0xa00ae278, 0xbdbdf21c,
    };

    const uint8_t *data = buffer;

    for (size_t i = 0; i < size; i++) {
        crc = (crc >> 4) ^ rtable[(crc ^ (data[i] >> 0)) & 0xf];
        crc = (crc >> 4) ^ rtable[(crc ^ (data[i] >> 4)) & 0xf];
    }

    return crc;
}
...
typedef uint32_t lfs_size_t
...
typedef uint32_t lfs_off_t
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
if (size >= hint && off % lfs->cfg->read_size == 0 &&
                size >= lfs->cfg->read_size) {
            // bypass cache?
            diff = lfs_aligndown(diff, lfs->cfg->read_size);
            int err = lfs->cfg->read(lfs->cfg, block, off, data, diff);
            if (err) {
                return err;
            }

            data += diff;
            off += diff;
            size -= diff;
            continue;
        }
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No reachable-to-unreachable path exists in the shown fragment. All conditions in the if expression can be true at runtime (size and hint are unsigned lfs_size_t, off is unsigned lfs_off_t), and when the condition holds diff is guaranteed to be >= lfs->cfg->read_size (diff is initialized to size and the if requires size >= read_size), so lfs_aligndown(diff, read_size) is non-zero and the subsequent read/data/offset updates are reachable. The surrounding logic (pcache/rcache adjustments) preserves diff > 0, and potential underflow of hint-i (when lfs_bd_crc passes hint-i) only affects whether the if condition is taken, not making any code in the fragment intrinsically unreachable.
